try that

public void SkillCape() {

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4359 && actionTimer == 0) { // 4359 = str skillcape
stillgfx(60, absY, absX); //Hole in ground
stillgfx(246, absY, absX); //Hole in ground
setAnimation(2761);
actionTimer = 2;
} else if (actionTimer == 2) {
setAnimation(2756);
actionTimer = 3;
} else if (actionTimer == 3) {
setAnimation(2763);
actionTimer = 4;
} else if (actionTimer == 4) {
setAnimation(2764);
actionTimer = 1;
}[/quote]

It should look like

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4359 && actionTimer == 0) { // 4359 = str skillcape stillgfx(60, absY, absX); //Hole in ground stillgfx(246, absY, absX); //Hole in ground setAnimation(2761); actionTimer = 2; } else if (actionTimer == 2) { setAnimation(2756); actionTimer = 3; } (else if (actionTimer == 3) { setAnimation(2763); actionTimer = 4; } (else if actionTimer == 4) { setAnimation(2764); actionTimer = 1; }

item.title: ~~~~~ Quick Help [Updated]~~~~~
item.dc:creator: @oniscape oniscape
item.description:
@oniscape wrote:

Kay let me give you the most crappy way to do it possible. IT ALL GOES IN CLIENT.JAVA, IM NOT LIEING

public void SkillCape(){
 new SkillCape.run();
}
public class SkillCape extends Thread {
 public void run(){
    if(playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4359){
stillgfx(60, absY, absX);
stillgfx(246, absY, absX);
setAnimation(2761);
Thread.sleep(500); //explanation, sleeps the thread for 500 milis, you may change it to your desires
setAnimation(2756);
Thread.sleep(500); //explanation, sleeps the thread for 500 milis, you may change it to your desires
setAnimation(2763);
Thread.sleep(500); //explanation, sleeps the thread for 500 milis, you may change it to your desires
setAnimation(2764);
    }
 }
}

I did not test this code, it’s right off the top of my head. May I say this is a CRAP way of doing it, but its better than process and sure as HELL better than his idea. It should work if it compiles correctly.

Read full topic

example

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4359) { // 4359 = str skillcape  
stillgfx(60, absY, absX); //Hole in ground 
stillgfx(246, absY, absX); //Hole in ground  
setAnimation(2761);
setAnimation(2756);
setAnimation(2763);
setAnimation(2764);

}

thanks!

item.title: ~~~~~ Quick Help [Updated]~~~~~
item.dc:creator: @Christiaan Christiaan
item.description:
@Christiaan wrote:

put this in your ClickingMost.java:

case 74077:
c.SkillCape();
break;

and make a void like this in your Client.java with all your skillcapes

public void SkillCape() {

if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4319) { // 4319 = attack skillcape
emote here;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4339) { // 4339 = herblore skillcape
emote here;
}
}

Read full topic
